With that, we are going to return now to Aeor at the midst of the Calamity, here in this place and time. →
For those coming back, the gods have not only infiltrated the city of Aeor, but have infiltrated Exandria itself, a plan decades in the making. →
While Exandria choked under ash and beset by monstrous hoards of the armies of the gods, both Prime and Betrayer alike, a plan was hatched to bypass the magical lords of the mighty city of Aeor, for the gods to take mortal form to pass those boundaries that only mortals could pass. →
Having arrived in Aeor disguised as humble ground-dwelling mortals bringing food, probably the last thing tethering Aeor to terrestrial Exandria, our gods discovered them and their companions would need to work quickly, that the Factorum Malleus was all but operational. →
Moving swiftly, our divine protagonists, we have to wait to find out if the word heroes is appropriate or not. →

(laugh) →

After all, this is a war between the gods, isn't it? Or are they not so much enemies as family? # KIRBY
And now, a message from your Critical Role lore keeper: Dani Carr. →
# DANI
We here at Critical Role know that life happens. →
Sometimes your friend becomes a rampaging werewolf that you gotta calm down. →
Sometimes your other friend needs help dealing with a dead lady in her head. →
We get it. →
And when life happens, we are not always able to watch four to five hours of Critical Role a week. →
That's why our lore department has been working tirelessly to find a way to make it both easier and faster to consume Critical Role's main campaign without losing that rich and vibrant tapestry of story and lore the Critter community has come to love. →
And after countless hours of hard work, we are happy to announce that we have found that way. →
Introducing Critical Role Abridged. →
Each episode of this lore keeper approved series has been carefully crafted by an incredibly devoted team to include everything you need to know to follow the Bells Hells stories all in about one hour. →
We've even added new pieces of artwork, bringing characters, items, and moments to life thanks to the help of our amazing community of artists from around the world. →
The time is now to begin your Critical Role catch up with abridged episodes of the Bells Hells campaign. →
New episodes air every Tuesday at 10:00 AM Pacific on YouTube. →
Beacon members receive two new episodes dropping every week on Tuesdays and Fridays. →

# TALIESIN
Delve into a new tabletop roleplaying game of investigative horror with the "Candela Obscura Core Rulebook" using the Illuminated Worlds System by Darrington Press. →
Roam the turn-of-the-century- inspired setting of the Fairelands, including the bustling city of Newfaire and the ancient ruins of Oldfaire below. →
Assemble a circle of investigators within the paranormal secret society of Candela Obscura. →
You'll analyze strange and horrifying events, fight back against dangerous phenomena, and contain the bleed that spreads from corruptive magick. →
Choose from 10 custom character sheets to empower your investigations and explorations. →
Use tactical intuition and brawn with the Soldier specialty, use your charm with finesse and flair as the Magician specialty, or study and practice mystical arts as an Occultist. →
Explore districts of Newfaire, competing organizations, four full assignments, and dozens of example assignments to inspire you. →
If you choose to brave the role of Game Master, this guide contains everything needed to pave the way for your Candela Obscura investigators. →
Offered in both a standard edition as well as an ornate limited edition for collectors, the "Candela Obscura Core Rulebook" contains 204 art-filled pages, including maps, items, immersive notes, mysteries, and plenty more to power your very own story. →
Keep this tome close for the knowledge obtained may be the key to protecting you, your allies, and the Fairelands. →

But you stand here and see the body of Cassida before you. →
You think back to the hospital, Father Milo left the room and Arcadia didn't. →
She heard what Cassida said. →
You think, how did that celestial hand the Knowing Mistress over to those archmagi? You look at the body of Cassida, another follower of yours destroyed by the Lord of the Hells, by the Betrayers. →
destroyed by the Lord of the Hells, by the Betrayers. →
He said that she renounced you before the end. →
Do you think that's true? →
# ASHLEY
It doesn't matter. →
I'll go over to her body and make her whole again. →
I know I won't bring her back. →
# BRENNAN
You make her whole, a thread goes from her to the Matron. →
Her soul is not so far gone. →
# ASHLEY
I just move her hair. →
I'm so sorry. →
I just look to the Dawnfather and the Matron. →
That didn't feel right. →
# LAURA
Can I go over to her and envelop her? →
# BRENNAN
Dark-- →
# ASHLEY
I just-- I'm so grateful for the embrace. →
# BRENNAN
Dark wings up above, storms, thundering, winds so fast that none can escape and yet, a tinge of gray in the dark storm. →
and yet, a tinge of gray in the dark storm. →
The sun is rising past the clouds at the edge of the horizon, as it must. →
# ASHLEY
My sister, let's go home. →
# BRENNAN
Cassida is left in repose. →
The knowledge dies with her. →
Hallis, her son, he was sent from here. →
Was he sent somewhere in the world of Exandria or was he sent somewhere far beyond that? →
# LAURA
He was sent to Exandria. →
That was my-- →
# BRENNAN
Everlight. →
How long do you stay in that embrace of the Matron before you let go? →
# ASHLEY
For a long time, and I finally let go of this mortal form. →
# BRENNAN
The last avatar unravels. →
You held on for as long as you could. →
High above the clouds, the sun rises. →
Under the storms, crawling things of pain and suffering, dark caves of spiders. →
Ruination and destruction follow the fleeing Lord of Hells, ready to wage war anew. →
A war that is the greatest warmth they will ever know. →
Above the clouds, the sun begins to rise as you all ascend and watch the roiling of the Stormlord pushing the city, speeding up. →
Let none survive this crash. →
Far above, you are joined by your sister, who appears in this moment as your form passes, Wildmother, and you appear here above the clouds. →
# LAURA
Is it possible to, before we leave this room-- →
# BRENNAN
Mm-hmm. →
# LAURA
I don't know a spell, but is there some sort of spell that can cast a like a bubble of protection? Like a dome to protect the body of Cassida. →
# BRENNAN
Yes. →
# LAURA
So she's not damaged when we crash. →
# BRENNAN
Yes. →
She will be preserved. →
The Lawbearer arrives. →
The Knowing Mistress stands with you. →
She looks. →
"The Lord of Hells will not be long gone. →
Once the city crashes, they will gather the others and they will know we are here. →
We should not dawdle long." →
# NICK
We had to try. →
# ASHLEY
I know. →
I know. →
# NICK
Hope is a painful thing. →
# BRENNAN
The Knowing Mistress looks to the Lawbearer. →
"Why didn't you, at the last minute, why didn't you come?" →
# NOSHIR
For love. →
If something were to happen to her, I could not break my own rules to save her. →
And so I gave up my son. →
Thank you for taking care of him. →
# LAURA
He was of pure heart. →
# NICK
Thank you, sister. →
# TALIESIN
Sister. →
# LAURA
Always. →
# ASHLEY
You carry a weight much heavier than all of us. →
I don't know why you do it. →
# LAURA
It is the path I chose. →
# BRENNAN
The city vanishes and all of you feel a noise, a sound, a pulse, impact, ruin. →
And with a final thud that ripples over the vast ocean waves, Aeor is brought low, smote by divine will against the face of Exandria. →
smote by divine will against the face of Exandria. →
The Knowing Mistress looks to you, Lawbearer. →
"You would not have us dwell here." →
# NOSHIR
Why are your children bound by rules that you will not follow? We have broken this place. →
# BRENNAN
"I agree." →
# ASHLEY
As do I. →
# TALIESIN
We have. →
Now what? →
# BRENNAN
"There is a way. →
Our efforts have been half measures. →
We seek to do as we did before, not to kill our kin who oppose us, to place them in realms of their own design that they craft into some torture, perhaps to torment us. →
I do not know. →
It will not last unless we close the door behind us." →
# LAURA
This is the only home I've ever known. →
# TALIESIN
This was ours. →
We-- No. No. →
# NOSHIR
Look how far they came, my love. →
They almost took it from us by force. →
# TALIESIN
I don't want to go. →
# LAURA
If we do this, it protects them from the others as well. →
# NICK
We protect them. →
# NOSHIR
Do we? Look at what you've wrought, Dawnfather. →
# LAURA
I have ushered many souls this day. →
# NOSHIR
We killed them for being good. →
My heart is tired. →
# BRENNAN
"There is much to be done. →
We must not tarry or dawdle. →
Each and every Betrayer need be sealed away before we even consider what is to become of us. →
But consider it, we must. →
If not today, then when some new sun rises. →
I saw that stone that streaked across the sky. →
Are you ready to fight again?" →
# ASHLEY
If it must be, yes. →
# BRENNAN
"I will think on what we have learned here. →
There are ways. →
We will address this Calamity. →
I believe that we can end it. →
We must try and be willing to do whatever it takes. →
Don't tarry long, my siblings." (fades) She vanishes. →
I would ask you to tell me how each of you leave this place. →
# TALIESIN
I walk up to my wife. →
I take her hands. →
I'm not angry. →
Not even a little. →
# NOSHIR
I couldn't. →
# TALIESIN
I couldn't have if you had been there. →
I couldn't have been that person. →
It was too much. →
# NOSHIR
A forest with rules. →
# TALIESIN
Mm-hmm. →
A perfect tree. →
# NOSHIR
Please tell me all about my son. →
# TALIESIN
(sighs) I take your hand and we walk, and I tell you every moment of that brave child. →
# BRENNAN
The Wildmother and Lawbearer depart. →
Who is next to leave? →
# ASHLEY
I'm going to walk up to the Matron. →
Please give them more time here. →
If they should come to see you a little too early, send them back. →
# LAURA
I cannot do that, not even for you, sister. →
But... →
I look up and there are threads, golden threads, above your head, infinite, and I point at two that are right next to each other and bring them low, shining very strong. →
They will do great things. →
Then you will see them again. →
# ASHLEY
We talk about how-- We talk about time a lot, and how their lives are just (snaps) a blip in ours. →
But having been here, But having been here, it's not about the length of time in a life, it's about how it's spent. →
And I would do it all over again. →
I love you all. →
# LAURA
We sacrifice much in these mortal forms, but I believe it was worth it. →
# NOSHIR
Was it? →

# NOSHIR

# BRENNAN
Everlight, you move from this place. →
Matron, do you follow behind? →
# LAURA
Yes, but before I do, I'm going to put my hand on your shoulder. →
You're full of surprises. →
Then I'll go. →
# BRENNAN
In the skies over the sea, the Arch Heart and the Dawnfather stand. →
The sun is fully risen. →
It's glorious. →
# ABUBAKAR
It's beautiful. →
# NICK
Thank you. →
# ABUBAKAR
You know, in my heart, I knew this was all going to happen. →
# LAURA
(laughs) →
# ABUBAKAR
I mean, they're our children after all. →
Got to go out there, do their own thing. →
It's what we did. →
# NICK
Not to see them. →
Not to stand by their side. →
Not to be there day after day. →
# ABUBAKAR
Yeah. →
Yeah. →
But that's what makes it so great. →
It makes those moments really last. →
Besides, we'll always be there in some way, shape, or form, the same way that they will always be with us. →
Like a scar. →
With that, I'm going to take a strand of my hair, twirl it in my finger, and throw it. →
We'll always be here. →
(snaps) And then book. →
# BRENNAN
Dawnfather, you stand amongst the clouds as the sun rises. →
This world, this beautiful world. →
Could you really bear to say goodbye? →
# NICK
I walk to the edge of the continent, where this island lays that now contains the crumbles of this once mighty city. →
Then the Dawnfather touches the earth Then the Dawnfather touches the earth and the water. →
He does not want to leave. →
But if his family is set on it, he cannot lose more. →
As he kneels there on the edge overlooking the water and the sun, I think he hears in his heart: Ayden. →
It's okay, Father. →
I think a final tear, I think a final tear, a final part of Ayden that hoped a final part of Ayden that hoped falls into the sea. →
And he stands resolute, not quite sure, but with his family, a distance that he does not know how to traverse ahead of him. →
He'll gaze up at the sun and shimmer in its light and vanish. →
# BRENNAN
When first the gods came to Exandria, they came from a realm of eternal possibility, and their first and greatest sacrifice was to become real. →
Now, reflected in that first tragedy, that first Calamity, is a reflection. →
that first Calamity, is a reflection. →
In short, brief life can even the infinite change, In short, brief life can even the infinite change, realize, recognize, commit to something new, singular. →
commit to something new, singular. →
To move forward on the paths of destiny and fate, changed. →
To move forward on the paths of destiny and fate, changed. →
Beautiful is the dawn. →
We do not see the gods. →
We only see light. →
# MATT
Light. →
Endless light of fractured divine memory captured in a long lost relic. →
Bits of cracked and ruined history realized once again. →
As the light fades here in this dark subterranean ruin, the ruination of a once great and terrifying city, these memories resurface once more. →
Here, in this glistening arcane sphere, in the hands of a man born in the lingering fires of what the gods have done. →
Here, the light has echoes. →
Here, who knows the danger these ripples might have. →
We'll pick up there next time with Bells Hells. →
(laughs softly) →
# ASHLEY
(sighs) →
# MATT
Thank you all so much for joining us, and is it Thursday yet? →
# ASHLEY
(sighing) Oh! →
# MATT
Good night. →
